content: Splitting off from the JSON thread - why do we call the rustdoc process inlining? Seems confusing to have something with the same name as the inlining that the compiler does.
I mean, I think it's actually a pretty intuitive name - it does the same things with documentation as inclining a function does with code. The use site is replaced with the full definition.
I agree that IMO it's actually a decent name. At this point I think it's too late to change the name anyway since it's used throughout so many issues and so much of the codebase.
It's also publically stable as #[doc(inline)] and #[doc(no_inline)] I believe
Good point, it's definitely too late then ;)
